wikipedia_page.main: Richard Parker (14 September 1894 – 1 January 1969) was an English professional football centre forward who made over 200 appearances in the Football League. He is best remembered for his three-year spell with Millwall, for whom he scored 62 goals in 88 league matches.

response: * Richard Parker, full name of footballer Dick Parker (1894–1969)

At the Loftus Road club, Johnson took up a more central role, replacing Dick Parker at centre-forward. In the 1924–25 season, Johnson was the club's top-scorer with ten league goals as Rangers finished just above the Third Division South re-election places. During the following season, Johnson lost his place to Daniel Burgess, only making nine appearances.
